alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 3:17PM MST until September 23 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SLATE CREEK BASIN REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GILA COUNTY... At 315 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Slate Creek basin. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Slate Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Slate Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila County This includes the following highways... State Route 188 between mile markers 268 and 269. State Route 87 near mile marker 230. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get to higher ground immediately! Raging flash flood waters and debris will inundate residences near State Route 188 along the banks of Slate Creek. Turn Around, Don`t Drown! National Forest Service Road 26 and low water crossings through Slate Creek will be washed out and impassable. Flood waters may overtop State Route 188 as culverts become clogged from flood debris. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
